articles.author: Meara Sharma
articles.title: How to Eat Dinner Like the Last Citizens of Pompeii
articles.description: The chef Heston Blumenthal’s latest exploration of historical appetites is a menu inspired by the final meals prepared in the doomed Roman city.
articles.content: In A.D. 79, a baker in the Roman town of Pompeii placed some loaves of bread in his oven. While they were baking, Mount Vesuvius erupted, raining down layers of hot ash and stone that would both extinguish life from the town and enshrine its final moments. In… [+6080 chars]

articles.author: Alissa Quart
articles.title: How Philanthropists Can Ease College Debt
articles.description: Forget big donations. Go for structural reforms.
articles.content: In May, the billionaire Robert Smith was widely lauded when he announced he would pay the student debt of Morehouse Colleges graduating class to the tune of $34 million. So were Michael Bloomberg, the former New York mayor and presidential candidate, who gave… [+1786 chars]

articles.author: Margaret Renkl
articles.title: The Story of the Surly Santa and the Tiny Christmas Miracle
articles.description: The smallest gifts can be the ones that linger in memory.
articles.content: Four grandparents, a great-aunt, a great-great aunt and all seven sets of regular aunts and uncles were dispatched on a search that spanned five states. For days the phone rang with reports. An ornamental French horn had been located in a florist-supply shop:… [+3084 chars]
